com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.rgb

Class ColorfulBatch

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.rgb.ColorfulBatch
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.Batch, com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Disposable

    public class ColorfulBatch
extends java.lang.Object
implements com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.Batch
    A substitute for SpriteBatch that adds an additional attribute to store an extra color's worth of channels, used to modify the RGB channels of a color by multiplication (called the "tweak") while the primary color affects the color additively (just called the color, often drawn from Palette or generated with ColorTools). This ColorfulBatch uses the RGB color space, like SpriteBatch, but the batch color here is additive for the red, green, and blue channels, while the tweak is multiplicative, and the neutral value for all RGB channels is 0.5 (instead of 1.0 for SpriteBatch). Additive values cause no change when they are 0.5, but cause a sharp increase at 1.0 and a sharp decrease at 0.0. In the tweak, r maps to multiplicative red, g maps to multiplicative green, b maps to multiplicative blue, and a maps to "exponential-like" contrast. Like with the additive values, 0.5 causes no change for multiplicative values, but you can think of the existing color as being temporarily shifted down by 0.5 for each of the RGB channels, so each RGB channel's range is -0.5 to 0.5 before being multiplied by the corresponding tweak value (times 2.0, which means multiplicative tweak values less than 0.5 make colors darker and values greater than 0.5 make colors lighter) and then shifted back to its prior range. Contrast is a special value; 0.5 still means "no change," but lower values will make lightness changes less distinct between similar colors, while higher values will "sharpen" the changes in lightness.
    Created by Tommy Ettinger on 12/14/2019.

      This is very different from the other overloads in this class; it assumes the float array it is given is in the format libGDX uses to give to SpriteBatch, that is, in groups of 20 floats per sprite.

      void drawExactly(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Texture texture, float[] spriteVertices, int offset, int count)
      Meant for code that uses ColorfulBatch specifically and can set an extra float (for the color tweak) per vertex, this is just like draw(Texture, float[], int, int) when used in other Batch implementations, but expects spriteVertices to have a length that is a multiple of 24 instead of 20.

        Constant Field Values

      • color

        protected float color

      • TWEAK_RESET

        public static final float TWEAK_RESET
        A constant packed float that can be assigned to this ColorfulBatch's tweak with setTweak(float) to make all of the tweak adjustments virtually imperceptible. When this is set as the tweak, it won't change the lightness multiplier or lightness contrast, and it won't change either chromatic value multiplier.

        protected float tweak

      • ColorfulBatch

        public ColorfulBatch(int size)
        Constructs a ColorfulBatch with one buffer and the default shader.
        See Also:
        ColorfulBatch(int, ShaderProgram)

      • ColorfulBatch

        public ColorfulBatch(int size,
                     com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.glutils.ShaderProgram defaultShader)
        Constructs a new ColorfulBatch. Sets the projection matrix to an orthographic projection with y-axis point upwards, x-axis point to the right and the origin being in the bottom left corner of the screen. The projection will be pixel perfect with respect to the current screen resolution.

        The defaultShader specifies the shader to use. Note that the names for uniforms for this default shader are different than the ones expect for shaders set with setShader(ShaderProgram). See createDefaultShader().

        Parameters:
        size - The max number of sprites in a single batch. Max of 10922.
        defaultShader - The default shader to use. This is not owned by the ColorfulBatch and must be disposed separately.

      • setColor

        public void setColor(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Color tint)
        Specified by:
        setColor in interface com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.Batch

      • setColor

        public void setColor(float red,
                     float green,
                     float blue,
                     float alpha)
        Sets the color to the result of ColorTools.rgb(float, float, float, float) on the same arguments. For the RGB parameters, 0.5f is a neutral value (causing no change), while for alpha, 1.0f is a neutral value. For RGB, higher values will add to the corresponding channel, while lower values will subtract from it.
        Specified by:
        setColor in interface com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.Batch
        Parameters:
        red - additive red channel, from 0 to 1; 0.5 is neutral
        green - additive green channel, from 0 to 1; 0.5 is neutral
        blue - additive blue channel, from 0 to 1; 0.5 is neutral
        alpha - multiplicative opacity, from 0 to 1; 1.0 is neutral
        See Also:
        ColorTools.rgb(float, float, float, float)

      • setColor

        public void setColor(float color)

      • setIntColor

        public void setIntColor(int color)

      • setIntColor

        public void setIntColor(int red,
                        int green,
                        int blue,
                        int alpha)
        Sets the color with the given RGB and A parameters from 0 to 255. For the RGB parameters, 127 is a neutral value (causing no change), while for alpha, 255 is a neutral value. For RGB, higher values will add to the corresponding channel, while lower values will subtract from it.
        Parameters:
        red - additive red channel; ranges from 0 to 255, and 127 is neutral
        green - additive green channel; ranges from 0 to 255, and 127 is neutral
        blue - additive blue channel; ranges from 0 to 255, and 127 is neutral
        alpha - multiplicative opacity; ranges from 0 to 255 (254 is equivalent, since the lowest bit is discarded)
        See Also:
        ColorTools.rgb(float, float, float, float)

      • setTweak

        public void setTweak(float red,
                     float green,
                     float blue,
                     float contrast)
        Sets the multiplicative and contrast parts of the shader's color changes. 0.5 is a neutral value that should have minimal effect on the image; using (0.5f, 0.5f, 0.5f, 0.5f) will effectively remove the tweak. You can also use setTweak(float) with TWEAK_RESET, which is very slightly more efficient, to remove the tweak or set it to a neutral value.
        Parameters:
        red - multiplicative red channel, from 0 to 1; 0.5 is neutral
        green - multiplicative green channel, from 0 to 1; 0.5 is neutral
        blue - multiplicative blue channel, from 0 to 1; 0.5 is neutral
        contrast - affects how lightness changes, from 0 (low contrast, cloudy look) to 1 (high contrast, sharpened look); 0.5 is neutral

      • setTweak

        public void setTweak(float tweak)

      • getTweak

        public float getTweak()

      • setIntTweak

        public void setIntTweak(int tweak)
        Takes the tweak as an int in the format: red (8 bits), green (8 bits), blue (8 bits), contrast (7 bits), (1 ignored bit at the end). An example would be 0xC820206E, which significantly emphasizes red (with red 0xC8, a little over 3/4 of the max and higher than the neutral value of 0x80), significantly reduces green and blue effect with green and blue multipliers of 0x20 (closer to 0, so most green and blue in the final color, if any, will come from the additive color), and slightly reduces contrast (with contrast and the ignored bit as 0x6E, which is less than the halfway point).
        Parameters:
        tweak - the tweak to use as an integer, with red in the most significant bits and contrast in least

      • setIntTweak

        public void setIntTweak(int red,
                        int green,
                        int blue,
                        int contrast)
        Sets the multiplicative and contrast parts of the shader's color changes. 127 is a neutral value that should have minimal effect on the image; using (127, 127, 127, 127) will effectively remove the tweak.
        Parameters:
        red - multiplicative red channel, from 0 to 255; 127 is neutral
        green - multiplicative green channel, from 0 to 255; 127 is neutral
        blue - multiplicative blue channel, from 0 to 255; 127 is neutral
        contrast - affects how lightness changes, from 0 (low contrast, cloudy look) to 255 (high contrast, sharpened look); 127 is neutral

      • setTweakedColor

        public void setTweakedColor(float color,
                            float tweak)
        A convenience method that sets both the color (with setColor(float)) and the tweak (with setTweak(float)) at the same time.
        Parameters:
        color - the additive components and alpha, as a packed float
        tweak - the multiplicative components and contrast, as a packed float

      • setTweakedColor

        public void setTweakedColor(float redAdd,
                            float greenAdd,
                            float blueAdd,
                            float alphaMul,
                            float redMul,
                            float greenMul,
                            float blueMul,
                            float contrast)
        A convenience method that sets both the color (with setColor(float, float, float, float)) and the tweak (with setTweak(float, float, float, float)) at the same time.
        Parameters:
        redAdd - additive red channel, from 0 to 1; 0.5 is neutral
        greenAdd - additive green channel, from 0 to 1; 0.5 is neutral
        blueAdd - additive blue channel, from 0 to 1; 0.5 is neutral
        alphaMul - multiplicative alpha channel, from 0 to 1; 1.0 is neutral
        redMul - multiplicative red channel, from 0 to 1; 0.5 is neutral
        greenMul - multiplicative green channel, from 0 to 1; 0.5 is neutral
        blueMul - multiplicative blue channel, from 0 to 1; 0.5 is neutral
        contrast - affects how lightness changes, from 0 (low contrast, cloudy look) to 1 (high contrast, sharpened look); 0.5 is neutral

      • draw

        public void draw(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Texture texture,
                 float[] spriteVertices,
                 int offset,
                 int count)
        This is very different from the other overloads in this class; it assumes the float array it is given is in the format libGDX uses to give to SpriteBatch, that is, in groups of 20 floats per sprite. ColorfulBatch uses 24 floats per sprite, to add tweak per color, so this does some conversion.
        Specified by:
        draw in interface com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.Batch
        Parameters:
        texture - the Texture being drawn from; usually an atlas or some parent Texture with lots of TextureRegions
        spriteVertices - not the same format as vertices in this class; should have a length that's a multiple of 20
        offset - where to start drawing vertices from spriteVertices
        count - how many vertices to draw from spriteVertices (20 vertices is one sprite)

      • drawExactly

        public void drawExactly(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Texture texture,
                        float[] spriteVertices,
                        int offset,
                        int count)
        Meant for code that uses ColorfulBatch specifically and can set an extra float (for the color tweak) per vertex, this is just like draw(Texture, float[], int, int) when used in other Batch implementations, but expects spriteVertices to have a length that is a multiple of 24 instead of 20.
        Parameters:
        texture - the Texture being drawn from; usually an atlas or some parent Texture with lots of TextureRegions
        spriteVertices - vertices formatted as this class uses them; length should be a multiple of 24
        offset - where to start drawing vertices from spriteVertices
        count - how many vertices to draw from spriteVertices (24 vertices is one sprite)
